alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 10 at 3:57PM PDT until July 10 at 4:30PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM PDT FOR NORTHWESTERN LINCOLN COUNTY... At 357 PM PDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 20 miles east of Banks Lake South, or 46 miles northeast of Moses Lake, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Wilbur, Almira, Sherman, and Govan. This includes U.S. Highway 2 in Washington between mile markers 208 and 227. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
